Description: Body (reconstructed from numerous fragments with two unjoined, and added plaster) of Corinthian blister ware pottery squat aryballos with base of neck and handle root; exterior: trace of grey wash; squat body covered in incised vertical lines extending from junction of neck and body towards wide curved edge of the flat base.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see G.R. Edwards, Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens, Vol. VII, Part III, 1975, 148, no. 768; I. McPhee and E.G. Pemberton, Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens, Vol. VII, Part 6, pl. 34, no. VII-15. The remains of the handle root indicate that the handle was affixed to the vessel after the incision marks were created on the walls of the vessel.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.303) (phase 3)
